cfallin commented on issue #4068:

One longer-term thought that occurs to me is that something like linear/affine types ("use-once values") would let us encode in the types in ISLE that a memory operand is only to be used once. That seems like the minimum language feature to actually provide full safety here. It has a lot of implications we'd have to think through though, so not a step to take lightly. Happy to talk about this more in another issue if desired.
